reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly mentions that Oliva is completely transparent about how they collect and use personal data. They act as Data Controller under the GDPR and UK GDPR and cover the entire journey of personal data processing.
reply.reference: We want to be completely transparent about how we collect and use your personal data. This privacy notice exists to tell you exactly how we do this. Any time we make a decision on processing personal data, we do it according to this notice‚Äîin data protection law terms, this means we're acting as a Data Controller under the GDPR and UK GDPR. Our privacy notice covers the entire journey of the personal data we process when you use our services‚Äîfrom the moment it enters our system, until it's time for us to say 'goodbye üëã', as well as the various stops it makes along the way. URL: https://legal.oliva.health/privacy-notice

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, users can opt out of data collection or request the deletion of data by contacting Oliva Health Ltd via email at data.protection@oliva.health, phone at (+44) 2071939425, or mail at 34b York Way, London N1 9AB, United Kingdom.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that users can exercise their rights to request data deletion or opt out of data collection by contacting Oliva Health Ltd through various methods.
reply.reference: If you wish to make a request about your personal data under your rights, contact us at data.protection@oliva.health, (+44) 2071939425, or Oliva Health Ltd, 34b York Way, London N1 9AB, United Kingdom. URL: https://legal.oliva.health/privacy-notice
